channel.title: Electronic guitar - link me any free lessons that will help?
channel.description:
I bought an electric guitar the other day, came with a DVD but it's useless, could any body provide me links that would help me get started? (exercises, lessons, tips)
inb4searchyoutube
Thanks.

item.title: Electronic guitar - link me any free lessons that will help?
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

I searched on thepiratebay.org for “guitar lessons” and yes, they helped me.

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5783918/GuitarTricks.com_Learn_Guitar_Tricks_Video_Lessons_Tutorial

I have some amazing links.

http://www.youtube.com

http://www.google.com

Good Luck, post some videos of you playing sometime? That would be cool.

Stop being a faggot you silly stupid fuck. He told you no youtube video’s.

LOL? Why u so mad?
[/quote]
because You were being a wiseguy
you probably need those links than he will ever need it[/quote]

“you probably need those links than he will ever need it” <- Wtf did you even try to say here? Also it was more of a joke than anything, which is why I asked him to please post videos of him playing throughout progression.

@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Aquire this
Download tabs for guitar pro from here
Play
???
Profit.

In all honestly, just practicing simple songs that you know and love will help you build confidence and you’ll have a better feel for the guitar in no time.

item.title: Electronic guitar - link me any free lessons that will help?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:4, topic:427461”][quote author=Classic_ link=topic=530155.msg3870363#msg3870363 date=1325300750]
Muroth, as i play electric guitar, i know it is actually not that hard, it is quite easy to learn really. I learned how to play myself and you can learn songs on youtube and notes, just get a electric guitar book. I hope you like Guitar as much as i do.

Wow, i actually said that.
[/quote]

I got the chords and frets down, i’m just pitiful when trying to play them. I tuned my guitar, sounds great. I know it’ll take a long time before I can actually start playing full songs, I just need exercises to help me build up my speed and hit the notes exact on spot.

@Wet Dreamss - sounds great, I got a basic Squier by fender[/quote]
Which one? I used to have a Squier Telecaster.

Read full topic
item.source: Electronic guitar - link me any free lessons that will help?

item.title: Electronic guitar - link me any free lessons that will help?
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“Wet Dreamss, post:3, topic:427461”]I could help teach you, just PM me any questions you have. (I’ve played guitar for about 8 years now)

They could be basic questions, advanced anything Don’t hesitate, no question is stupid when you don’t know the answer

edit: classic same here, I’m getting a 92 Gibson les paul for my birthday, my dad said yes. Hell yes.

OP if you played guitar hero on expert and did well, it should be easy.[/quote]
I wish, I can only afford an Epiphone (It cost $800) But guys please dont say it is a fake gibson, as it is actually just the sister company of gibson.

Read full topic
